quantityRules.description: Single gecko requires 20 gallons vertical minimum (18Ã—18Ã—24 inches). Cohabitation NOT recommended due to stress and aggression. Each additional gecko requires +10 gallons and significant risk assessment.

temperament: Docile and handleable, tolerates handling well
setupTips: Prioritize vertical space - height more important than floor space
Provide lots of branches and cork bark for climbing
Use vertical plants (real or fake) for cover and humidity
notes: Nocturnal and arboreal - active at night, lives in trees
Very docile and easy to handle
Can drop tail when stressed - will NOT regrow
Unique diet - can thrive on commercial crested gecko diet (CGD)
Crested geckos come in a variety of colors and patterns due to selective breeding
Do not have eyelids, instead lick their eyes to keep them clean and moist

warnings.message: Never grab by tail - they will drop it and it will NOT grow back (permanent loss unlike leopard geckos)
Temperatures above 82Â°F can cause heat stress and death. No basking lamps needed - room temperature (72-78Â°F) is ideal.
Cohabitation often results in stress, aggression, tail loss, and injuries. Single housing strongly recommended.
Males are extremely aggressive toward each other - NEVER house two males together under any circumstances.

feedingRequirements: Omnivorous - primary diet is commercial crested gecko diet (CGD powder mixed with water)
Best CGD brands: Repashy, Pangea, Arcadia EarthPro Custodian
Live insects (crickets, dubia roaches) offered 1-2x weekly for enrichment and protein
Insects must be appropriately sized (no wider than space between gecko's eyes)
Dust insects with calcium supplement (Repashy Calcium Plus or similar)
Avoid: Baby food (nutritionally inadequate), jelly pots (high sugar), mealworms as staple (high fat)
feedingSchedule: Hatchlings (0-3 months): CGD nightly, fruit flies or pinhead crickets 3x weekly
Juveniles (3-12 months): CGD nightly, insects 2-3x weekly
Sub-adults (12-18 months): CGD every other night, insects 1-2x weekly
Adults (18+ months): CGD 3x weekly, insects 1-2x weekly
Breeding females: CGD nightly, insects 2x weekly (increased calcium demand)
waterNotes: Provide shallow water dish (2-3 inches diameter) at all times in cool zone
Crested geckos are 'droplet drinkers' - they prefer licking water droplets from leaves after misting
Mist enclosure 1-2x daily (evening preferred) to provide drinking droplets
Change water dish daily to prevent bacterial growth
mistingNotes: Mist once in evening (after lights out) or twice daily (morning + evening)
Target humidity: 60-80% ambient, allow to dry to 60% before next misting
Misting schedule: Light misting for 10-15 seconds until droplets form on leaves
Bioactive setups may require less frequent misting due to substrate moisture retention
During shedding: Increase misting frequency to maintain 70-80% humidity
